snippet: Apple didn’t release a new iPad in the first half of the year, as it usually does, and guess what happened? Sales of tablets worldwide took a dip.
abstract: Apple didn’t release a new iPad in the first half of the year, as it usually does, and guess what happened? Sales of tablets worldwide took a dip.

headline.main: With No New iPad, Tablet Market Takes a Dip
headline.print_headline:
Lacking a New iPad,
Tablet Market Lags

snippet: Without major news or many earnings reports, the markets were sleepy as they finished the slowest trading day of 2013.
abstract: Lack of major news leaves stock market directionless in slowest full trading day of 2013.

headline.main: Wall Street Mixed in Slowest Trading Session of Year
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Mixed in Slowest Trading Session of Year

snippet: A look at the competition from Chinese makers to Apple’s iPhone, which is no longer the most sought after phone in the country, and the state of the government’s effort to stabilize economic growth.
abstract: A look at the competition from Chinese makers to Apple’s iPhone, which is no longer the most sought after phone in the country, and the state of the government’s effort to stabilize economic growth.

headline.main: The Changing State of Smartphone Competition in China

snippet: The jurors in the S.E.C.’s case against Fabrice Tourre say their decision came down to what they saw as the letter of the law. | A revised agreement over Dell keeps the takeover effort alive. | Clawback policies, though a hot topic, are rarely enf...
abstract: The jurors in the S.E.C.’s case against Fabrice Tourre say their decision came down to what they saw as the letter of the law. | A revised agreement over Dell keeps the takeover effort alive. | Clawback policies, though a hot topic, are rarely enforced. | Bank of New York Mellon wins a gender bias case.

headline.main: A Focus on Greed in Tourre Case

snippet: Time Warner Cable and CBS battle over retransmission fees like divorcing parents, leaving viewers like traumatized children.
abstract: Alessandra Stanley The TV Watch column describes shock encountered by many television viewers upon discovering that Time Warner Cable is no longer showing CBS; compares situation to ugly divorce in which companies are irrational parents and viewers negatively-affected children.

headline.main: Maybe CBS Can Visit Me on Weekends
headline.print_headline: Maybe CBS Can Visit Me On Weekends

snippet: Unions say the company has imported American-style business practices that stand at odds with European norms.
abstract: Amazon is facing strikes at warehouses in Germany, its second biggest market, where unions say company has imported American-style business practices--in particular, antipathy to organized labor--that stand at odds with European norms.

headline.main: In Germany, Union Culture Clashes With Amazon’s Labor Practices
headline.print_headline: In Germany, Union Culture Clashes With Amazon’s Labor Practices

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and MELISSA EDDY
